item.title: Jakkie's HTML (Javascript) Codes - stopped with it
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Neither are really html, both are really js.
Opening add to favorites is really annoying, I would never go back to a site that did that.
Client-side IP block is really iffy, people can simply disable javascript, so fairly useless. Htaccess does a much better job.

Read full topic
item.source: Jakkie's HTML (Javascript) Codes - stopped with it

item.title: Jakkie's HTML (Javascript) Codes - stopped with it
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[center][size=15pt]J a k k i e ’ s H T M L C o d e s[/size][/center]
current scripts: 3
do i add more scripts later? nope, i stop

I have created some HTML codes, i hope someone finds it useful
[center]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/center]

[center]Auto-Favourites[/center]
This tut opens the ‘add to favourites’ window automaticly if the page is loaded
Change the [tt][/tt] tag by this as an onloader:

<body onLoad="if(document.all) window.external.AddFavorite(window.document.location,window.document.title)">

[center]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/center]
[center]IP-BLOCKER[/center]
This script allows you to block diffrent IP Adresses!!! ;D
Paste this into the [tt][/tt] of the site:

[code] [/code]
[center]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/center]
[center]Right-click dislabled[/center]
This script stops people from right-clicking
Paste this into the web pages [tt][/tt]:

[code] [/code] [center]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/center]

[center]Any requests? Blah blah blah, i don’t listen to it anymore[/center]

Read full topic
